stories.text:
I am building an online marketplace for service providers. The service provider will have the option of two profiles, basic vs. premium profile. My current thoughts on pricing structure are as follows.

Basic Profile - Limited feature set - Free + transaction fee

Premium Profile - Full feature set - $25 a month + smaller transaction fee

How large should transaction fees be in order to not have vendors move off platform / be discouraged from working with us but still enough to make some money? What’s the sweet spot?

Should the transaction fee be taken from the vendor side or on the customer side as an additional charge at checkout?

Should there be a small flat fee put on transactions?

Any other things / options to do?

Any advice on this would be greatly appreciated
stories.title: How to price SaaS, Need advice

stories.text:
I saw this comment on a thread and it resonanted with me

personally i tihnk modern cellphones are remarkably clunky devices for anything other than reading books and gps. they aren't even very ergonomic as phones, they're annoying for web browsing compared to laptops, and they are definitely not satisfying to use as controls for physical devices.

This sums up what i feel. What do you think about it? Are smartphones inherently wrong?
stories.title: Ask HN: Are Smartphones Too Clunky?
